What to Know About the Healthnicon Application Form Portal

The Healthnicon Application portal is designed to accept applications from candidates seeking admission into the University. In the portal, applicants can Purchase application forms, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print Acknowledgement Slips, check the admission list, etc.

Healthnicon

Healthnicon is a private nursing college in South Africa that offers a variety of nursing programs, including enrolled nursing, auxiliary nursing, and nursing auxiliary. The college has multiple campuses located in different parts of South Africa, including Johannesburg, Pretoria, and Durban.

Here are some key facts about Healthnicon:

  • Healthnicon was established in 1995 and is registered with the South African Department of Higher Education and Training.
  • The college offers both certificate and diploma programs in nursing, and some programs are also accredited by the South African Nursing Council (SANC).
  • The college has modern facilities, including simulation labs and a library, and provides practical training in a variety of healthcare settings.
  • Healthnicon has a strong focus on community engagement and provides healthcare services to underprivileged communities.
  • The college has a team of experienced lecturers who provide academic and personal support to students.
  • Healthnicon also offers short courses in healthcare, including basic life support, HIV/AIDS counseling, and wound care.
  • The college has a flexible learning model that allows students to study part-time or full-time, and some programs can be completed online.

Healthnicon Application Requirements

The admission requirements for Healthnicon vary depending on the specific program and level of study. However, here are some general requirements for nursing programs at Healthnicon:
  1. Matric certificate or equivalent qualification.
  2. Grade 12 certificate with Mathematics and English as subjects, or an NQF Level 4 qualification that includes Mathematics and English.
  3. An average grade of at least 50% in Mathematics and English.
  4. A valid South African ID or passport.
  5. A certified copy of your academic record.
  6. A certified copy of your identity document or passport.
  7. A completed application form.

In addition to the above requirements, some nursing programs at Healthnicon may also require the following:

  1. Proof of immunization and a medical certificate.
  2. A criminal record check.
  3. A personal interview.
  4. A passing score on the National Benchmark Test (NBT) for some programs.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible for admission to the Healthnicon application portal, candidates must;

  • Have Secondary School Leaving Certificate
  • Meet National Senior Certificate (NSC) requirement for admission into Higher Certificate
  • Grade 12 certificate applicant is of added advantage
  • Must write the NBTs for admission to Healthnicon on/before 15 October 2024.
  • FPS of 480 or above.
  • NBT scores of Upper
  • Intermediate for AL & QL
  • Mathematics 60%
  • English HL 50%
  • English FAL 60%

How to Apply | Healthnicon Application Form 2024

To apply to Healthnicon, you can follow these steps:
  1. Visit the Healthnicon website at https://healthnicon.co.za/
  2. Click on the “Apply Now” button on the top right-hand side of the homepage.
  3. Select the campus and program you are interested in applying for.
  4. Fill out the online application form with your personal details, academic information, and supporting documentation.
  5. Upload your required documents, such as a certified copy of your matric certificate or academic record, ID or passport, and any other required documents.
  6. Pay the application fee, if required, through the online portal.
  7. Submit your completed application.

 

Healthnicon Application Required Documents

To apply to Healthnicon you need to submit the following documentation:

  • A completed application form
  • A copy of your results for the latest school year
  • A copy of your ID
  • If you have attended another higher education institution, we need a copy of your academic transcript
